revised_title: Development of High-Performance Silicon Carbide Fibers and Composites from Organosilicon Polymers
tldr: The author describes the development of high-performance silicon carbide fibers and composites from organosilicon polymers through heat treatment. These materials have potential applications in refractory structural materials, supporters for catalysts, and high-temperature-resistant materials. The process involves converting organosilicon polymers into silicon carbide at relatively low temperatures, resulting in amorphous materials with high mechanical strength and chemical resistance.
